function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"High connectivity through rail and flights increases the spread of contagious diseases like COVID-19.","Impact":"Rapid spread of disease to multiple cities and countries.","Mitigation":"Implement travel restrictions and quarantine measures for highly connected regions.","Technologies":"Contact tracing apps, temperature screening technology.","People":"Travelers from highly connected regions, local residents in cities with high connectivity.","Owner":"Government, public health authorities, transportation authorities."},{"Description":"Urban planning that does not prioritize open space, natural ventilation, and sunlight can contribute to the spread of infection.","Impact":"Increased risk of infection transmission in dense urban environments.","Mitigation":"Allocate larger areas for open and agricultural regions, increase dimensions of corridors, and modify construction materials to reduce infection transmission.","Technologies":"Virtual modeling for urban planning, building materials with anti-microbial properties.","People":"Urban planners, architects, city developers, local residents.","Owner":"Urban planning authorities, government, construction industry."},{"Description":"Poor filtration and ventilation systems in buildings can increase the risk of airborne transmission of SARS-CoV-2.","Impact":"Higher likelihood of indoor transmission of the virus.","Mitigation":"Proper installation and maintenance of filtration systems, higher air-exchange rates, and outside air fractions in buildings.","Technologies":"High-efficiency filters, air purification systems, ventilation monitoring technology.","People":"Building occupants, healthcare workers, visitors.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, healthcare organizations."}]}
